article: On Monday evening, I received a message online from a student who had got a very mean message in his locker . He took a picture of it and sent it to me asking for _ . I suggested that he _ me at break the following morning. A few hours later, I _ on the Internet that he had posted the picture of the mean note and asked if anyone _ who it was. Obviously, he was trying to give the person who did it a little _ in coming forward. The next day when the _ came, the boy came to me and another _ was with him. The boy showed me another note he had received. _ this was a heartfelt _ . I asked him if he knew who had written it, and the boy who came with him _ : "It was me. I don't know _ I did it, but I know it was wrong and not at all _ . So I wrote him this note. I also wrote 150 post-its with kind sayings on them and _ them onto all the lockers. I just wanted to do something to try to make up for my meanness." My heart felt so full of _ for this boy. I told him how _ I thought it was of him to come _ and how amazing it was that he did somethingkindto try to balance his mistake. I turned to the boy who received both notes and asked him if he also _ the bravery and could _ . Without hesitation, he said: "Yes. _ . Courage is virtue."
